Orishas is a trio of expatriate Cubans based in France that has lorded over Latino hip-hop since their 1999 debut.
Their reputation rests on an invigorating alchemy of old and new Latin American rhythms.
The group's zippy turntables and vibrating base lines aren't surprising, but few other hip-hop acts toss them into a cauldron of congas, horns and leaping pianos.
And the menacing, boastful lyrics that you expect from hip-hop?
